snippet: The Constitutional Court said Tuesday that a majority of the electorate must vote in order for a referendum on ousting the president to be valid.
abstract: Romania's Constitutional Court says that a majority of the electorate must vote in order for a referendum on ousting the president to be valid, a ruling that may make it harder for Pres Traian Basescu’s opponents to push him out.
lead_paragraph: The Constitutional Court said Tuesday that a majority of the electorate must vote in order for a referendum on ousting the president to be valid.

headline.main: Romania: Court Raises Bar for Impeachment Vote
headline.print_headline: Romania: Court Raises Bar for Impeachment Vote
